title: Smoky and milky potions
data:
**Smoky and milky potions** are two of the randomly generated colors of [potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion"); they can be any type. However, they are noteworthy because they have a chance of summoning a monster upon [quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff"): the smoky potion may summon a [djinni](/wiki/Djinni "Djinni") and the milky potion may summon a [ghost](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost"). If the monster appears, the potion does not have its normal effect.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Smoky potions](#Smoky_potions)
  - [1.1 Chance of producing a djinni](#Chance_of_producing_a_djinni)

- [2 Milky potions](#Milky_potions)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [3.1 Smoky potions and wishing](#Smoky_potions_and_wishing)
  - [3.2 Alchemy](#Alchemy)
  - [3.3 Combat](#Combat)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [4.2 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [5 External links](#External_links)

- [6 References](#References)

## Smoky potions

Quaffing a smoky potion has a 113 + 2`n` chance of producing a djinni, where `n` is the number of djinn that have been created in this game.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) This djinni might grant you a [wish](/wiki/Wish "Wish"), become [tame](/wiki/Tame "Tame"), be peaceful, vanish instantly, or turn hostile; the chances of each outcome depend on the [beatitude](/wiki/Beatitude "Beatitude") of the potion and are identical to the chances for [magic lamps](/wiki/Magic_lamp "Magic lamp"). Blessed smoky potions are the most likely to give a wish.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

The effect of quaffing a smoky potion does *not* depend on whether or not you have [identified](/wiki/Identification "Identification") that type of potion. If you have identified smoky potions but have forgotten which ones they are, you can use [\\](/wiki/%5C "\\") or [\`](/wiki/%60 "`") to check your current identification knowledge.

Djinn can also be summoned when a monster quaffs a smoky potion. The djinni will disappear 50% of the time; the other 50% it will be peaceful. In neither case will it grant wishes, though it does count toward the total number of djinn created.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

### Chance of producing a djinni

| Djinn already created        |          | 0     | 1     | 2     | 3     | 4     | 5     | *n*          |
| ---------------------------- | -------- | ----- | ----- | ----- | ----- | ----- | ----- | ------------ |
| Chance of producing a djinni |          | 7.69% | 6.67% | 5.88% | 5.26% | 4.76% | 4.35% | 113 + 2*n*   |
| Overall chance of wish       | Blessed  | 6.15% | 5.33% | 4.71% | 4.21% | 3.81% | 3.48% | 465 + 10*n*  |
|                              | Uncursed | 1.53% | 1.33% | 1.18% | 1.05% | 0.95% | 0.87% | 165 + 10*n*  |
|                              | Cursed   | 0.38% | 0.33% | 0.29% | 0.26% | 0.24% | 0.22% | 1260 + 40*n* |

## Milky potions

Milky potions have a chance of containing a hostile ghost; unless you are [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind") when you quaff the milky potion, you will also be rendered immobile for 3 turns, which notably ignores [free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action").[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) As with djinn, the probability of a milky potion generating a ghost is based on the number of ghosts already generated by any means: 113 + 2`n`, where `n` is the number of ghosts already generated. Since there will always be a large number of ghosts in the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead"), the chance of getting a ghost from a potion decreases significantly after that point.

A monster quaffing a milky potion can also summon a ghost, paralyzing them for 3 turns.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

## Strategy

### Smoky potions and wishing

Because of the possibility of a wish, it is worth blessing and quaffing all smoky potions, even if they are an otherwise useless or harmful type, especially because harmful potions are less harmful when blessed. In some cases, however, precautions must still be taken; the table below outlines these cases and what can be done to mitigate their effects:

| Potion                                                                   | Cost | Blessed result         | Mitigation                                                                                                      |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------------ | ---- | ---------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness")                | 50   | Lose 1 HP, abuse Con   | Quickly recovered                                                                                               |
| [confusion](/wiki/Potion_of_confusion "Potion of confusion")             | 100  | Confusion, abuse Con   | [Unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn"), or just wait (it's quite short)                              |
| [hallucination](/wiki/Potion_of_hallucination "Potion of hallucination") | 100  | Hallucination          | Unicorn horn                                                                                                    |
| [sleeping](/wiki/Potion_of_sleeping "Potion of sleeping")                | 100  | Sleep                  | [Sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance")                                                   |
| [blindness](/wiki/Potion_of_blindness "Potion of blindness")             | 150  | Blindness              | Unicorn horn                                                                                                    |
| [invisibility](/wiki/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility")    | 150  | Permanent invisibility | Wear [mummy wrapping](/wiki/Mummy_wrapping "Mummy wrapping")                                                    |
| [polymorph](/wiki/Potion_of_polymorph "Potion of polymorph")             | 200  | Polymorph              | [Unchanging](/wiki/Unchanging "Unchanging") or [polymorph control](/wiki/Polymorph_control "Polymorph control") |
| [levitation](/wiki/Potion_of_levitation "Potion of levitation")          | 200  | Levitation             | Press [>](/wiki/Angle_bracket "Angle bracket") to float gently to the ground                                    |
| [acid](/wiki/Potion_of_acid "Potion of acid")                            | 250  | Lose 1–4 HP, abuse Con | [Acid resistance](/wiki/Acid_resistance "Acid resistance") or recover                                           |
| [oil](/wiki/Potion_of_oil "Potion of oil")                               | 250  | Abuse Wis              | Quickly recovered                                                                                               |
| [paralysis](/wiki/Potion_of_paralysis "Potion of paralysis")             | 300  | Paralysis              | [Free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action")                                                                  |

Probably the worst of these is the potion of polymorph, whose effect is not easily resisted and can be quite devastating without precautions. Unchanging is preferable to polymorph control for this case, since it avoids breaking polyselfless conduct *and* shuffling stats from polymorph into your own race.

In the case of potions of sleep and paralysis, a locked closet with a burned Elbereth square or scroll of scare monster is a reasonably secure substitute: almost all phasing, digging or door-destroying monsters respect Elbereth, although the latter two may open the way for non-Elbereth respecting monsters. A [sanctuary](/wiki/Sanctuary "Sanctuary") is an even better substitute, although still not as good as free action since [angelic beings](/wiki/Angelic_being "Angelic being") may still attack you.

### Alchemy

Another problem can occur if smoky potions are [healing](/wiki/Potion_of_healing "Potion of healing") or [extra healing](/wiki/Potion_of_extra_healing "Potion of extra healing"), since players generally want to alchemize these to [full healing](/wiki/Potion_of_full_healing "Potion of full healing"). The dilemma posed is such: get more HP, or get a wish? In this case, one should go for the alchemy - on average, for the potions required to get one wish, you will get 45 extra HP if smoky potions are extra healing, and 105 extra HP if smoky potions are healing. The extra HP is pretty much always better in the latter case, and usually better in the former case, especially given that many items can be obtained without wishing.

### Combat

Both of these potions can be dangerous to players in tense situations:

- Being paralyzed for three turns from a milky potion producing a ghost can be deadly against particularly nasty monsters, though the effect can be avoided by [blinding](/wiki/Blind "Blind") yourself.
- The smoky potion has obvious benefits of a potential wish, but you still miss out on that potion's effect, which can be fatal if trying to quaff your only smoky potion of full healing at low health produces a tame djinni instead.

## Variants

### UnNetHack

- *Main article: [Wish#UnNetHack](/wiki/Wish#UnNetHack "Wish")*

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), wishes cannot be used on magical items unless they are from a [wand of wishing](/wiki/Wand_of_wishing "Wand of wishing").

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), monsters can wish for items if the smoky potion they attempted to quaff produces a djinni that grants a wish.

## External links

- [Wishing spoiler](http://nh.gmuf.com/wish.html)

## References

4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/muse.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 106](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/muse.c#L106)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/potion.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 465](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/potion.c#L465)

Smoky and milky potions

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

Smoky and milky potions are two of the randomly generated colors of potion; they can be any type. However, they are noteworthy because they have a chance of summoning a monster upon quaffing: the smoky potion may summon a djinni and the milky potion may summon a ghost. If the monster appears, the potion does not have its normal effect.

Contents

    • 1.1 Chance of producing a djinni
  • 2 Milky potions
  • 3 Strategy

Smoky potions

Quaffing a smoky potion has a 113 + 2n chance of producing a djinni, where n is the number of djinn that have been created in this game.[1][2] This djinni might grant you a wish, become tame, be peaceful, vanish instantly, or turn hostile; the chances of each outcome depend on the beatitude of the potion and are identical to the chances for magic lamps. Blessed smoky potions are the most likely to give a wish.[3]

The effect of quaffing a smoky potion does not depend on whether or not you have identified that type of potion. If you have identified smoky potions but have forgotten which ones they are, you can use \ or ` to check your current identification knowledge.

Djinn can also be summoned when a monster quaffs a smoky potion. The djinni will disappear 50% of the time; the other 50% it will be peaceful. In neither case will it grant wishes, though it does count toward the total number of djinn created.[4]

Chance of producing a djinni

Djinn already created 0 1 2 3 4 5 n
Chance of producing a djinni 7.69% 6.67% 5.88% 5.26% 4.76% 4.35% 113 + 2n
Overall chance of wish Blessed 6.15% 5.33% 4.71% 4.21% 3.81% 3.48% 465 + 10n
Uncursed 1.53% 1.33% 1.18% 1.05% 0.95% 0.87% 165 + 10n
Cursed 0.38% 0.33% 0.29% 0.26% 0.24% 0.22% 1260 + 40n

Milky potions

Milky potions have a chance of containing a hostile ghost; unless you are blind when you quaff the milky potion, you will also be rendered immobile for 3 turns, which notably ignores free action.[5] As with djinn, the probability of a milky potion generating a ghost is based on the number of ghosts already generated by any means: 113 + 2n, where n is the number of ghosts already generated. Since there will always be a large number of ghosts in the Valley of the Dead, the chance of getting a ghost from a potion decreases significantly after that point.

A monster quaffing a milky potion can also summon a ghost, paralyzing them for 3 turns.[6]

Strategy

Smoky potions and wishing

Because of the possibility of a wish, it is worth blessing and quaffing all smoky potions, even if they are an otherwise useless or harmful type, especially because harmful potions are less harmful when blessed. In some cases, however, precautions must still be taken; the table below outlines these cases and what can be done to mitigate their effects:

Potion Cost Blessed result Mitigation
sickness 50 Lose 1 HP, abuse Con Quickly recovered
confusion 100 Confusion, abuse Con Unicorn horn, or just wait (it's quite short)
hallucination 100 Hallucination Unicorn horn
sleeping 100 Sleep Sleep resistance
blindness 150 Blindness Unicorn horn
invisibility 150 Permanent invisibility Wear mummy wrapping
polymorph 200 Polymorph Unchanging or polymorph control
levitation 200 Levitation Press > to float gently to the ground
acid 250 Lose 1–4 HP, abuse Con Acid resistance or recover
oil 250 Abuse Wis Quickly recovered
paralysis 300 Paralysis Free action

The extra HP is pretty much always better in the latter case, and usually better in the former case, especially given that many items can be obtained without wishing.

Variants

In UnNetHack, wishes cannot be used on magical items unless they are from a wand of wishing.
